description:
Kdevelop has many wonderful features but the killer feature for me is semantic hilighting: when editing text the color of an object does not depend on its type (like in normal syntax hilighting) but its identity --- i.e. each local variable gets a distinct color, each function a distinct color. Its makes reading code so much easier. Of course, it has other very nice features. The more notable ones which I personally use are:

 -- superb intellisense support for several languages (the ones I use are Python, C++, PHP)
 -- debugger support (I only use the C++ one, but the Python one should work too)
 -- documentation integration (PHP, Qt, Python to some extent)
 -- CMake support
 -- git integration (could use some redesign for commit workflow --- I still use git cola)
 -- nice git blame integration
 -- all the features from Kate (expecially block selection and regexp search and replace)
 -- refactoring support (renaming a variable, function...)
 -- built-in bash konsole
 -- built-in linter
summary: This is the best IDE I've ever tried

description: I use mainly for C/C++, PHP and bash. The colour coding is excellent and the debugging features are outstanding. Integration with git works very well. I can't imagine using anything else as it does everything I need in an IDE.
summary: I use this IDE every day !

description: It's an amazing IDE and with the new v5 is it even more amazing. I really love to use it in my daily in work as well as in my freetime.
When i create a project, where is my cpp?

description: It works perfect with c++
summary: is the best IDE for c++

I can't install on ubuntu
Great IDE. I would love to see it little more friendly.
A simple install of my project, automatically does the kdesrc-build process. And i can just run to see any changes I've made. Much easier than Qt Creator.
It's OK. It uses Kate as the editor. It cannot see hidden files. For me it using it for PHP it has started to intermittently freeze and / or crash.
It is only 3.1 MB in size but it takes almost 10 min. for me. However my internet connection speed is good enough.

It fast...Its lean...It`s.... Kdevelop 

For progemming first approch this was the most fun IDE i used it doesn't take too much memory and it`s quite fast and responsive with all the language support i need (C++/Qt).
summary: The best graphical IDE I ever used

description: One of the very few IDEs I used that has good support for meson and c++17. Probably one of the best c++ IDEs for linux if you don't want to shell out tonnes of money for clion.
summary: One of the best c++ IDEs

description: KDevelop is all around an amazing IDE and makes it easy to write C++ programs. The integrated terminal even allows me to run applications which use STDIN (please add STDIN support for the run tab). Semantic highlighting is amazing too and since I run plasma, it is compatible with whatever theme I throw at it. But there's a problem when creating a C++ KDE Frameworks Application where CMakeLists.txt is corrupt or something and it refuses to compile. Please fix that, if you do I will rate 5 stars.
its stucked at 0, although my internet is working perfectly fine (if isse fixes will probably come and edit the review).

No IDE comes even close to the features provided by KDevelop. There are some IDE's (particulary Java-based ones) that might offer some cool features at the expense of all your physical memory but they are not match for this awesome piece of software.
I can't uninstall it to free up disk space, running low

Tried to install, won't. It says that is installed and gives option to remove. Can't remove, no packages. So it is not installed nor useable and cannot be removed... Awesome. Shame because there aren't many good options for FOSS C/C++ IDE's that actually work for Ubuntu. Even Code::blocks is messed up. Don't waste time on this nonsense.
Debugging does not work

That's really sad, as it looked very promising.
Installed it under fedora and opened it, but I could not enter a project name.
Hence I could not go on :-(

I'm sorry, I would have loved to give it a try.
BTW. the Star ranking above (1 star meaning 'Hate it' is an expression of the current zeitgeist, but nonetheless not the right thing to do: Usability ranking [0-9] would have been much better)
summary: Couldn't type in name for a new Project

description: It is the best C++ IDE on linux!

Failed to configure project 'Test2' (error message: Exit code 1). As a result, KDevelop's code understanding will likely be broken.

To fix this issue, please ensure that the project's CMakeLists.txt files are correct, and KDevelop is configured to use the correct CMake version and settings. Then right-click the project item in the projects tool view and click 'Reload'

Mein System ist Debian 11
Ich bin Programmieranfänger und wenn ich nach jedem Neustart des Programmes dauernd den Launcher neu einstellen darf ist es nicht so toll. Nach mehreren hin und her klicken und löschen des Builds war ich auch erst in der Lage, meine paar Zeilen neu kompilieren zu lassen. Zudem hat er wohl dauernd Probleme mit der Session und fragt mich ob ich weiter machen oder ob ich ein Cache clear machen möchte.

Very good support of C++ (with fast syntax analysis with clang for example) and Python (syntax analysis, debugger, etc ...).
The last version when I write these lines is the 5.6.1.
AppImages available on KDevelop web site (so very easy to (not) install to use it).
Решил попробывать, интересны его возможности, вроде симпатичный

Пожалуй самая продвинутая IDE для linux, лучшая подсветка синдаксиса и удобное автодополнение кода, плюс поддержка целой кучи языков.

Но есть пару неприятных недостатков, иногда появляющиеся баги, особенно после свежих обнов. И при работе с большим количеством кода появляются тормоза.

Очень не понравился вид брейкоинтов, так и не понял как сдалать кружочки рядом с номерами строк что бы мышкой можно было ставить. Неинтуитивные настройки.
Поддержка cmake просто лучшая из всех.
